content:
Apex Legends is a great game, and I'm happy to help you check if your PC can handle it.

According to the system requirements for Apex Legends, here's how your PC stacks up:

* Processor: Intel Core i7-9700K (meets the recommended requirement of at least an Intel Core i5-3570K or AMD equivalent)
* Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 (exceeds the recommended requirement of an NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB or AMD equivalent)
* RAM: 16 GB DDR4 3200 MHz (meets the recommended requirement of at least 8 GB DDR3 RAM)
* Operating System: Windows 10 (meets the minimum requirement)

With your PC, you should be able to play Apex Legends at high graphics settings, including 144 FPS and high-resolution textures. You might even be able to turn on some of the more demanding features like ray tracing and ambient occlusion.

It's worth noting that Apex Legends is a relatively well-optimized game, so you might be able to get away with lower graphics settings if you want to prioritize frame rate or reduce the load on your GPU. But with your RTX 3080, you should be able to crank up the graphics and enjoy a smooth, visually stunning experience.

As for Cyberpunk 2077, I'm sure you'll have a blast playing it. The game's world and story look incredibly immersive, and the gameplay demos have been really impressive. Are you planning on playing as a specific character build or exploring different playstyles?

Also, have you thought about checking out any other multiplayer games or genres? There are some great options out there, like Overwatch, Rainbow Six Siege, or even some of the newer battle royale games like Call of Duty: Warzone.
